African elephants are herbivores and primarily feed on grasses, bark, roots, leaves, and small stems. They also eat fruits, berries, and twigs. They have been known to eat crops such as sugarcane, bananas, and mangoes.
African elephants are herbivores and consume a variety of vegetation, including grasses, leaves, bark, shrubs, fruit, and roots. They also drink up to 50 gallons of water a day.
